isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE AND VEHICLE FEATURES - Optional Features - Service Procedure

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Temperature Compensation and Engine Warning Protection System (EWPS)
svcsubproc.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation reduces fuel delivery if Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) is above cooling system specifications.
The reduction in fuel delivery begins when ECT reaches approximately 107°C (224.6°F). A relatively rapid reduction of 15% will be achieved as the ECT reaches approximately 109°C (229°F).

The red ENGINE lamp will come on when ECT reaches approximately 109°C (228°F). A warning buzzer will sound when ECT reaches approximately 112°C (234°F). The engine will shut down when the ECT reaches approximately 121°C (250°F), if 3 way protection is disabled.
Fuel reduction is calibrated to a maximum of 40% before standard engine warning or optional warning/protection is engaged. If warning or shutdown occurs, a DTC is stored in the ECM memory.

note.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation may be disabled in emergency vehicles that require 100% power on demand.
